admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The Year 2000 (Y2K) Technical Assistance
            Project seeks to: a) contain and minimize the disruption in
            the country's social and economic infrastructure that
            will be caused by the failure of critical central, state,
            and local government systems to process dates after December
            31, 1999; and b) coordinate Y2K efforts in key sectors,
            monitor closely the evolving overall national situation, and
            prepare measures to deal with possible disruptions. There
            are two primary components: 1) Public sector Y2K efforts
            will address the Y2K problems of many agencies which have
            large computerized applications that are at risk. Since many
            of the applications were developed in-house, the remedial
            efforts will similarly be done that way. Many at-risk items
            require the procurement of upgrades or replacements. Goods
            will therefore form the bulk of the intended expenditure
            under this component. 2) National coordination efforts will
            cover the coordination of contingency planning, critical
            services with cross dependencies, national monitoring,
            dissemination efforts, public information management, legal
            planning, etc.
